[{'created': '2019-06-27 12:51:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix type error on call to mount device

The call in nova.virt.disk.mount.api.Mount.mnt_dev() to
nova.privsep.fs.mount() should include the `options` argument to
fulfill with the method signature.

The test test_do_mount_need_to_specify_fs_type has been modified to
check that the caller use the correct signature.

Closes-Bug: 1829506

Change-Id: Id14993db6ea33b2da14caa4b58671fc57c182706
Signed-off-by: Miguel Herranz <miguel@midokura.com>
(cherry picked from commit d2ef1ce309c28a5416af4cc00662ad6925574004)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix type error on call to mount device

The call in nova.virt.disk.mount.api.Mount.mnt_dev() to
nova.privsep.fs.mount() should include the `options` argument to
fulfill with the method signature.

The test test_do_mount_need_to_specify_fs_type has been modified to
check that the caller use the correct signature.

Closes-Bug: 1829506

Change-Id: Id14993db6ea33b2da14caa4b58671fc57c182706
Signed-off-by: Miguel Herranz <miguel@midokura.com>
(cherry picked from commit d2ef1ce309c28a5416af4cc00662ad6925574004)

commit_message:
Kibana: Add basic Helm tests

This adds basic Helm tests to the Kibana chart. These tests simply
check whether the .kibana index exists in Elasticsearch, checks
that the .kibana index has a status of 'open', and checks that the
health of the index is not red.

Change-Id: Iee40d073ec5e2a228736a193f4291306b815ccdc

web gui

The requirements team has defined a new strategy for handling

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for new upper constraints strategy

The requirements team has defined a new strategy for handling
upper constraints[1]. This patch applies those strategies to
Octavia-lib.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/ \
    2019-May/006478.html

commit_message:
Add playbook to stop containers

We need to stop several containers on the upgrades workflow.

This submission allows to reduce the duplicated code in THT.
It also handles the case in which we have podman as the CLI
but the containers running with docker.

Change-Id: I3c0580893aed5bda46d9104ffcee0f00cbabd9ee

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In documentation zuul job graphviz package ('dot' command) is needed.
Without that the job fails with:
    dot command 'dot' cannot be run (needed for graphviz output),
    check the graphviz_dot setting

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: Ib9a720379ca997f848212eeca68ed9f32e4ed349
(cherry picked from commit 50f3de69ae2b00f9b6f95756eb072b44fae548d3)
(cherry picked from commit dba7395c2355edae19f0f73a3b45825b6e8b564c)
(cherry picked from commit 770f4b257253908da3f228197f87f0a36b701dd6)
(cherry picked from commit aabbec67b1e36fbe8ad9965c7aca23dfe46a9a56)

commit_message:
DNM - Under discussion - make f28 standalone check job voting

This is the only python3 job currently.
Until rhel8 is ready to merge, make f28 voting to stop any
python3 errors.

Change-Id: Ib982ea7492daaf447a3afe86d20dd175eba78a9d

commit_message:
Adds build-images role - migrates image build in ci to a role

This migrates the code under playbooks/tripleo-buildimage to a
buid-images role in /roles/. Tracked by tripleo-ci squad in [1].
This will also allow for re use in rdo-jobs or elsewhere.

Mostly copies existing code - some main additions/changes:
 - removes the obsolete run.yaml
 - existing run-v3 is split into pre/run-v2/post playbooks
 - playbooks/tripleo-buildimage moves to playbooks/tripleo-buildimages
   (for consistency and since the role is build-images)
 - existing shell task for building images is moved to a template
 - adds support for py3 packages and image-yaml config files.
[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/956

Change-Id: Ie092b0430f10ad461e02d8361b557ab11c3993c0

commit_message:
Correct the comment of RequestSpec's network_metadata

The network_metadata won't be persisted inside RequestSpec obj.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ff0f33cf7e44c5d01f3fb999295eff4508c24a14/nova/objects/request_spec.py#L533

But there is comment said the network_metadata field should be
assigned before creating the RequestSpec obj, that is incorrect
description. This patch removes that comment, also adds some notes
for the fields which isn't persisted in RequestSpec obj.

Change-Id: I0ef451a6bac8f5caa837be62a0c2b335b9ed776b
Closes-Bug: 1834005

commit_message:
Allow skipping RHSM with Leapp

Useful when developing and testing.

Also, we don't need to be explicitly installing RHSM, instead we
should ensure that it doesn't get removed by accident if it needs to
be present.

Change-Id: I65ccf3436bf3816b52c40a7e154511ab3a2e43be
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit 2ca7c550390f5978d1dab3c78a1b84fe073f8ed0)

[{'created': '2019-07-04 09:43:01.000000000', 'message': "Use goal state to defer distributing ssh data

If goal state is available, this patch uses it to defer distributing the
known_hosts and authorized_keys to the related nova-compute units until
the last nova-compute unit expected has joined and triggered a
cloud-compute-relation-changed hook.  This means that all of the hosts
have been scanned and thus the whole group (per relation id) can be set.

Note that this patch does not unify the known_hosts/authorized_keys
files across relations.  That's for a separate patch.

Change-Id: I6c26ebbad2236e66c174ef4606828db834803865
Related-Bug: #1833420
"}]
commit_message:
Use goal state to defer distributing ssh data

If goal state is available, this patch uses it to defer distributing the
known_hosts and authorized_keys to the related nova-compute units until
the last nova-compute unit expected has joined and triggered a
cloud-compute-relation-changed hook.  This means that all of the hosts
have been scanned and thus the whole group (per relation id) can be set.

Note that this patch does not unify the known_hosts/authorized_keys
files across relations.  That's for a separate patch.

Change-Id: I6c26ebbad2236e66c174ef4606828db834803865
Related-Bug: #1833420

commit_message:
Use POST/Redirect/GET for an instance resize form

This patch improves UX by blocking a second POST request during page
reload after "Confirm instance resize" action

Closes-Bug: #1826509
Change-Id: I80c66f7828be17ccf06840a06229c447ccb1bb67

commit_message:
[WIP] Bump Pyroute2 version to 0.5.2

Bumped Pyroute2 version to 0.5.2, same a stable/rocky. A memory leak
has been detected in the current version (0.4.21) but not in the one
proposed.

A Neutron dependant patch has been submitted to execute a full CI check
with this new version.

Change-Id: I1b257fccf44842975afa17e86e81d0f78924fd4a
Closes-Bug: #1835044

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-17 13:46:15.000000000', 'message': "Remove ipxe tags when ipxe6 is in use.

Turns out the dhcp server doesn't always do the right thing
and our duplicated tags seem to create confusion. So lets
remove them so ipxe6 will work.

Change-Id: I446cb814ae41cfd1e9a4ed45f27dac17e9b5bb61

(cherry picked from commit 2fde1940b5a5a6624ed7a2dadf609eb2a80530cd)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove ipxe tags when ipxe6 is in use.

Turns out the dhcp server doesn't always do the right thing
and our duplicated tags seem to create confusion. So lets
remove them so ipxe6 will work.

Change-Id: I446cb814ae41cfd1e9a4ed45f27dac17e9b5bb61
Story: 2005885
Task: 33734
(cherry picked from commit 2fde1940b5a5a6624ed7a2dadf609eb2a80530cd)

Specify endpoint when creating monasca user

otherwise I'm seeing:

TASK [monasca : Creating the monasca agent user] ****************************************************************************************************************************
fatal: [monitor1]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "module_stderr": "Shared connection to 172.16.3.24 closed.
", "module_stdout": "Traceback (most recent call last):

ile "/tmp/ansible_I0RmxQ/ansible_module_kolla_toolbox.py", line 163, in <module>
    main()

 in main
    output = client.exec_start(job)
  File "/opt/kayobe/venvs/kolla-ansible/lib/python2.7/site-packages/docker/utils/decorators.py", line 19, in wrapped

    return f(self, resource_id, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/kayobe/venvs/kolla-ansible/lib/python2.7/site-packages/docker/api/exec_api.py", line 165, in exec_start\
n    return self._read_from_socket(res, stream, tty)

socket

n    n = next_frame_size(socket)

commit_message:
Fix variables indentation for ceph-health validation

The default variables for a validation playbook should not be included
in the metadata array level.

Change-Id: I645af2be9a1c269ed4a635e3299164c94d6ac810
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit bb48a7f577ffe4d40b95c92b151122a9d581505b)

messages:
[{'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-05-17 11:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-05-17 12:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-31935 : SUCCESS in 1h 02m 42s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-05-17 13:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/659780/1 : FAILURE in 2h 09m 05s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-17 16:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is a good fix, thank you. But we clearly need to add test coverage for this code path. That should be done here, please.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-06-07 02:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Add an assertion on mock_mount in the following test method.

https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/d7bad342981eb843cf349fce4f6b8f0309e2af3a/nova/tests/unit/virt/disk/mount/test_nbd.py#L248-L262'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-07 14:23:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Takashi, I'm not sure if Miguel is still active. If you want to propose the test fix I can approve it. Thanks in advance."}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-12 19:22:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Eric, sorry for the lack of feedback. @Takashi, thanks for the pointer to the test. Shouldn't adding 'autospec=True' (https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html#autospeccing) make the mock library to enforce the signature of the original mocked function? I gave it a quick try, but it seems it is not working, maybe you have some clue. I making it work would make test more reliable to any API change, but maybe there is a reason why it is not applied already to this and other tests."}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-12 19:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"I making ..." -> "I think that making ..."'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-12 22:32:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Shouldn't adding 'autospec=True'

Theoretically, yes, but I can't make it work either. I've found autospeccing to be notoriously finicky. It may have something to do with the fact that we're using 3rd-party rather than standard mock; or that we're doing some level of autospeccing internally anyway.

Adding mock_mount.assert_called_once_with(...) works just fine; let's go with that."}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-26 18:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-26 19:18:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Eric, I investigated a little more in depth the issue (mostly to improve my understanding of the problem) and I added a patch that does not rely on knowing the actual signature.

> Adding mock_mount.assert_called_once_with(...) works just fine; let's go with that.

On the other hand, maybe the solution I propose is a little more complex and not aligned to other parts of the code, so if you think it would be better to just use the `mock_mount.assert_caller_once_with(mock.ANY, mock.ANY, mock.ANY, mock.ANY)` let me know to change it (or any other part)"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-26 19:18:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

See inline. I'm glad you figured out how to get the autospec working, but we can't go with this.

Also, pep8 is going to fail."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-26 19:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Whoops, we crossed in the mail.

Yes, please use assert_called_once_with instead, as noted.

Thanks Miguel!'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-06-26 19:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-33212 : FAILURE in 53m 24s'}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-26 20:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Eric no problem :) I think that relying in actively checking the method signature in every test is a problem, but you are totally right this is not the place to address that. I came today to the issue again directly on my local git repo without looking at gerrit first, so I did not see again your comment about using the simple assert, and I worked out the other solution. After sending it and checking gerrit again I just saw your last comment, so I figured out the solution was flawed already. I will send the solution later or maybe tomorrow morning (Europe timezone)'}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-26 21:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-26 21:55:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Yikes this has been regressed since Queens:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/494423/

But I can't believe anyone is even using libvirt+lxc in nova anymore (or that it works - but I guess it doesn't). I gave up on trying to get integration testing working for this configuration (libvirt+lxc) long ago."}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-26 21:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Eric, I have sent the update patch. Also, checking some documentation about pep8 and hacking OpenStack I have seen a style guide recommendation (the rule is not enforced) with id [H210] about autospec in tests (https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html#unit-tests-and-assertraises). It comments about the problem of asserting the mock calls without checking the arguments while spec is disabled. Is not the same as in our case, that lack any assert entirely, but somehow related. Anyway it looks like a know problem/issue that is addressed case by case.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-26 22:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-26 22:14:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Very soft -1 on making the assertion of the mocked call a bit tighter - I can push that change up myself if you're fine with it."}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-26 22:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

@Matt, yes, looks like nobody is using LXC anymore, at least the vanilla one without LXD. I am having other issues in my tests that I would like to report into separate bug/issues.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-26 22:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-26 22:17:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I updated the unit test, lgtm otherwise. Let's be sure to backport."}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-26 22:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-26 22:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 19490, 'date': '2019-06-26 22:19:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The call in nova.virt.disk.mount.api.Mount.mnt_dev() to
nova.privsep.fs.mount() should include the `options` argument to
fulfill with the method signature.

The test test_do_mount_need_to_specify_fs_type has been modified to
check that the callers use the correct signature.

Apparently mock patch autospec is not working properly [1], so a
custom mock patch spec is used.

Also, since that function is decorated by a privilege separation entry
point decorator [2], the actual signature has to be obtained from the
first arg of the partial function returned by the decorator [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslotest/blob/master/oslotest/mock_fixture.py#L91
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/privsep/fs.py#L32
[3] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.privsep/blob/master/oslo_privsep/priv_context.py#L230

Closes-Bug: 1829506

commit_message:
Fix type error on call to mount device

The call in nova.virt.disk.mount.api.Mount.mnt_dev() to
nova.privsep.fs.mount() should include the `options` argument to
fulfill with the method signature.

The test test_do_mount_need_to_specify_fs_type has been modified to
check that the caller use the correct signature.

Closes-Bug: 1829506

Change-Id: Id14993db6ea33b2da14caa4b58671fc57c182706
Signed-off-by: Miguel Herranz <miguel@midokura.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 19316, 'name': 'Eduardo Gonzalez', 'email': 'dabarren@gmail.com', 'username': 'egonzalez90'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'email': 'radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com', 'username': 'yoctozepto'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-06-27 15:30:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-06-27 15:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-06-28 17:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-07-03 06:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Good catch'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-04 08:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I thought the idea was that you should not need to update your zuul config when you branch. What does this get us?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-04 08:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

periodic-stable runs an hour later than periodic and uses mail notifications. Other than that, there are no real differences I am aware of.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-04 08:47:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> periodic-stable runs an hour later than periodic and uses mail
 > notifications. Other than that, there are no real differences I am
 > aware of.

Mail notifications would be nice. It would be nice if we had a way to avoid needing to change this in new stable branches in future. If we changed to periodic-stable in master, would zuul know to skip jobs on master in that pipeline?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-04 09:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Due to July 4 in the USA, we need to postpone this discussion till Zuul masters return from their holidays.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-07-04 16:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I feel like this is more a question for https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html whether they want jobs for deployment projects reporting via the http://lists.openstack.org/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/openstack-stable-maint ML.

As for explicit branch matchers on periodic jobs in master branches, that should work (negative lookahead eliminating master for the stable-periodic pipeline, and a master branch only match for the periodic pipeline). Subsequently branching that configuration will continue to have the desired effect.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-07-08 08:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-07-08 08:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-08 08:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
CI: Move to periodic-stable

For stable branches we should be using periodic-stable pipeline instead
of periodic.

Change-Id: I046e72ccb03da4fbb67ef4be3ac365425b2c91c7
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
CI: Use template-overrides.j2 from kolla

Some kolla-ansible jobs failed due to using external mirrors
instead of local ones.
This was due to not using the template override provided by kolla.
This patch fixes that.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/668815
Change-Id: I27f714fdf05e521aa8ce25c5683a452ceb35eeb8
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 20ab480ca541ad2c76d7bcdc57e0a076c7bf6df4)

commit_message:
CI: Keep stderr in ansible logs

Otherwise ara had only the stderr part and logs only the
stdout part which made ordered analysis harder.

Additionally add -vvv for the bootstrap-servers run.

Change-Id: Ia42ac9b90a17245e9df277c40bda24308ebcd11d
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b9aa8b38f4cfa504b3068f596d42a8c69c09091a)

including 'version' and 'successful'.

commit_message:
Add upgrade-bifrost command

This performs the same as a deploy-bifrost, but first stops the
bifrost services and container if they are running.

This can help where a docker stop may lead to an ungraceful shutdown,
possibly due to running multiple services in one container.

Change-Id: I131ab3c0e850a1d7f5c814ab65385e3a03dfcc74
Implements: blueprint bifrost-upgrade
Closes-Bug: #1834332
(cherry picked from commit 9cac1137d02f9de87fd03b1b5d0e6f5a99a32419)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-27 11:29:27.000000000', 'message': "Fixes for MariaDB recovery

* Fix wsrep sequence number detection. Log message format is
  'WSREP: Recovered position: <UUID>:<seqno>' but we were picking out
  the UUID rather than the sequence number. This is as good as random.

* Add become: true to log file removal since
  I4a5ebcedaccb9261dbc958ec67e8077d7980e496 added become: true to the
  'docker cp' command which creates it.

* Don't run handlers during recovery. If the config files change we
  would end up restarting the cluster twice.

* Wait for wsrep recovery container completion (don't detach). This
  avoids a potential race between wsrep recovery and the subsequent
  'stop_container'.

Change-Id: Iaf7862be1affab390f811fc485fd0eb6879fd583
Closes-Bug: #1834467

commit_message:
Fixes for MariaDB bootstrap and recovery

* Fix wsrep sequence number detection. Log message format is
  'WSREP: Recovered position: <UUID>:<seqno>' but we were picking out
  the UUID rather than the sequence number. This is as good as random.

* Add become: true to log file reading and removal since
  I4a5ebcedaccb9261dbc958ec67e8077d7980e496 added become: true to the
  'docker cp' command which creates it.

* Don't run handlers during recovery. If the config files change we
  would end up restarting the cluster twice.

* Wait for wsrep recovery container completion (don't detach). This
  avoids a potential race between wsrep recovery and the subsequent
  'stop_container'.

* Finally, we now wait for the bootstrap host to report that it is in
  an OPERATIONAL state. Without this we can see errors where the
  MariaDB cluster is not ready when used by other services.

Change-Id: Iaf7862be1affab390f811fc485fd0eb6879fd583
Closes-Bug: #1834467

commit_message:
Per-Role krb-service-principal for CompactServices

Filter krb-service-principals for the CompactServices
based on the networks associated with the role.

Filtering for the IndividualServices was added in previous
fix https://review.openstack.org/646005, which did'nt
fully fix the bug.

Closes-Bug: #1821377
Change-Id: Id54477ca5581e1f5fe8a09c3bc60a238d114dbb2
(cherry picked from commit 578bcb2ffad32c6a39d68b5dc360504e95972ffa)

Deletes validations directory

All the validations directory contents have been migrated into Ansible
Roles then this directory could be now deleted.

Implements: blueprint validation-framework
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace "group spec" with "group type spec"

In the group type spec page, title "group type spec" and
"group spec" are used inconsistently. So this patch
replace "group spec" with "group type spec"

Closes-bug: #1821284

Change-Id: I8450ad55585791c8472ec233b9535809716ed12a
(cherry picked from commit 6c8674dc5d14c6a3d5bfcdadfce49a55232ca2ed)

commit_message:
Clean up test_virtapi

The security group and aggregate metadata wrinkles in the
tests were orphaned with changes I0326f25754e7a13dfc18f207242052412189c743
and Ia057dcc43c555187a4a1466a9e748b978c46d4a4 respectively. As a result
we can remove that code from the tests and also remove the context
argument passed to the virtapi methods since the only virtapi
function, wait_for_instance_event, does not take a context parameter.
ComputeVirtAPITest.assertExpected is also unused and removed here.

Change-Id: I6730652145f07d6964fe9f93a96fae88cee72273

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In documentation zuul job graphviz package ('dot' command) is needed.
Without that the job fails with:
    dot command 'dot' cannot be run (needed for graphviz output),
    check the graphviz_dot setting

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: Ib9a720379ca997f848212eeca68ed9f32e4ed349
(cherry picked from commit 50f3de69ae2b00f9b6f95756eb072b44fae548d3)
(cherry picked from commit dba7395c2355edae19f0f73a3b45825b6e8b564c)

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In test jobs the script tools/test-setup.sh is called which requires
mysql and postgres servers and clients to be installed.

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In test jobs the script tools/test-setup.sh is called which requires
mysql and postgres servers and clients to be installed.

Conflicts:
      tox.ini

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In test jobs the script tools/test-setup.sh is called which requires
mysql and postgres servers and clients to be installed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: I6b237ecf55ff440b5f5c956ee849a1927bb15441
(cherry picked from commit f34e53ebf7670f51f16d5d96412a42fa7f3a8232)

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In documentation zuul job graphviz package ('dot' command) is needed.
Without that the job fails with:
    dot command 'dot' cannot be run (needed for graphviz output),
    check the graphviz_dot setting

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: I5efddfc72e9dc0dd1b8b9e1e37708e1d30ef3c39
(cherry picked from commit feac47186d79569bb564e18216e07f18ed5ccd8b)

commit_message:
Switch to openstackdocstheme

oslosphinx has been retired[1] and is no longer compatible with the
latest Sphinx. Use openstackdocstheme instead.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/649070

Change-Id: Idb2fd37dcff7a6fe05d4874134ace49c227a78ae

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for new upper constraints strategy

The requirements team has defined a new strategy for handling
upper constraints[1]. This patch applies those strategies to
Octavia.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/ \
    2019-May/006478.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 06:37:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add emulated TPM support to Nova -- testcase test only

This code enables adding emulated TPM support to a guest instance
as described in the specs.  Support for cold migration and resize is
added in a follow-on patch.

The feature can be requested by specifying the desired TPM version
as a trait in either the flavor extra-specs or the image properties.

trait:COMPUTE_SECURITY_TPM_2_0=required will enable vTPM 2.0 support
trait:COMPUTE_SECURITY_TPM_1_2=required will enable vTPM 1.2 support

If the host supports new enough versions of libvirt and qemu and has
the necessary binaries installed it will advertise the above traits.

For vTPM 2.0, there are two device models available; TIS and CRB with
TIS being the default. The model can be selected in the flavor
extra-specs by specifying hw:tpm_model=TIS or hw:tpm_model=CRB. The
model can also be selected by specifying "hw_tpm_model" in the image
properties.

If the image properties and flavor extra-specs specify mutually-
incompatible settings, an exception will be raised in nova-compute.

blueprint: add-emulated-virtual-tpm

Change-Id: I1ff51f608b85dbb621814e70079ecfdd3d1a1d23
Signed-off-by: Paul-Emile Element <Paul-Emile.Element@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add emulated TPM support to Nova -- testcase test only

This code enables adding emulated TPM support to a guest instance
as described in the specs.  Support for cold migration and resize is
added in a follow-on patch.

The feature can be requested by specifying the desired TPM version
as a trait in either the flavor extra-specs or the image properties.

trait:COMPUTE_SECURITY_TPM_2_0=required will enable vTPM 2.0 support
trait:COMPUTE_SECURITY_TPM_1_2=required will enable vTPM 1.2 support

If the host supports new enough versions of libvirt and qemu and has
the necessary binaries installed it will advertise the above traits.

For vTPM 2.0, there are two device models available; TIS and CRB with
TIS being the default. The model can be selected in the flavor
extra-specs by specifying hw:tpm_model=TIS or hw:tpm_model=CRB. The
model can also be selected by specifying "hw_tpm_model" in the image
properties.

If the image properties and flavor extra-specs specify mutually-
incompatible settings, an exception will be raised in nova-compute.

blueprint: add-emulated-virtual-tpm

Change-Id: I1ff51f608b85dbb621814e70079ecfdd3d1a1d23
Signed-off-by: Paul-Emile Element <Paul-Emile.Element@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Add support for emulated virtual TPM

There are a class of applications which expect to use a TPM device
to store secrets.  In order to run these applications in a virtual
machine, it would be useful to expose a virtual TPM device within
the guest.  Accordingly, the suggestion is to create a placement
trait which could be requested in the flavor or image which would
cause such a device to be added to the VM by the relevant virt
driver.

Change-Id: I4b3a62b01edfbb0965f3366358735536718e6e6c
blueprint: add-emulated-virtual-tpm

subject: Modify the syntax error of 'ln' command in doc
messages:
[{'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2019-06-24 09:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-06-25 15:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Is this for https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1833554 ?

The command is not incorrect, it is fine to use a directory as a link name:

$ sudo ln -s /usr/share/keystone/wsgi-keystone.conf /etc/httpd/conf.d/
$ ls -l /etc/httpd/conf.d
total 16
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 2926 Apr 24 13:45 autoindex.conf
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 366 Apr 24 13:46 README
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 1252 Apr 24 13:44 userdir.conf
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 824 Apr 24 13:44 welcome.conf
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 38 Jun 21 21:11 wsgi-keystone.conf -> /usr/share/keystone/wsgi-keystone.conf

Are you seeing some kind of error message?'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2019-07-08 03:02:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Is this for https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1833554 ?
 > 
 > The command is not incorrect, it is fine to use a directory as a
 > link name:

 > /etc/httpd/conf.d/
 > $ ls -l /etc/httpd/conf.d
 > total 16
 > -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 2926 Apr 24 13:45 autoindex.conf
 > -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 366 Apr 24 13:46 README
 > -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 1252 Apr 24 13:44 userdir.conf

I tested this command with other files, and it worked. But I don't know why it doesn't work when I configure keystone. I saw that someone is fixing this problem. I will give up my patch and participate in their discussion. Thanks for your review."}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2019-07-08 03:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2019-06-24 09:34:39.000000000', 'message': "Modify the syntax error of 'ln' command in doc

In keystone install document, we use 'ln' command to create a

commit_message:
Modify the syntax error of 'ln' command in doc

In keystone install document, we use 'ln' command to create a
synchronized link to the file in another location. But the
syntax of 'ln' command is incorrect in this document.
The patch modifies the syntax error.

Change-Id: Idf9f3f53ed73de10292ace11b0be80a940dae8dd

commit_message:
Remove the old generic driver

The old generic driver is not used by any other driver, this
patch removed these unused file.

We will add the new generic driver in follow up.

Change-Id: I620409f162a29727fe205421f92a71dda04356f4

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for new upper constraints strategy

The requirements team has defined a new strategy for handling
upper constraints[1]. This patch applies those strategies to
Octavia.
This also corrects a lower constraint for oslo.messaging.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/ \
    2019-May/006478.html

Change-Id: I0be0ebf040aa127950a71b6550cea6c79cb18d6a

commit_message:
Adjust some HA router log

In case router is concurrently deleted, so the HA
state change LOG is not necessary. It sometimes
makes us confusing.
Also print the log for the pid of router
keepalived-state-change child process.

Change-Id: Id57dd787c254994af967db17647a3a28925714da
Related-Bug: #1798475

commit_message:
Nova: add service token

Add capability for nova to send service token.  Default to disabled.
Config setup is similar to keystone_authtoken.

Change-Id: I666f8f52fed50c61f67397b3da58133a2f9b49d3
Signed-off-by: Gerry Kopec <Gerry.Kopec@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Neutron: remove readiness probe from init container

Remove the readiness probe from the neutron-sriov-agent-init init
container of the neutron-sriov-agent DaemonSet, and use the probe
template for the neutron-sriov-agent container.

Change-Id: Iaa1fbca0b2d5ba1b0c15b82b6e8927c2b7be9f52

commit_message:
Bump api_version to 1.35

This commit bump the api_version from 1.32 to 1.35 at client side.
The corresponding changes at server side are:

* 1.32 -> 1.33: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652300/
* 1.33 -> 1.34: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/642288/
* 1.34 -> 1.35: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657280/

Note: there is no change required besides bumpping the api version.

Change-Id: Ie3e59bc1dae2dc73a3239c9705739afae8645126

commit_message:
Add container engine authentication support

We need to be able to run a docker or podman login during the
deployment if the overcloud needs to pull images from an auth
required container registry when deploying with docker. Add
ContainerImageRegistryLogin as a flag to use
ContainerImageRegistryCredentials to perform docker or podman logins
when deploying.

Closes-Bug: #1833584
Change-Id: I98a527f363056767fea45ab4828ae61c01de20ca
(cherry picked from commit ea37ee6638b08375974ae3ceddd6dc136c67b983)

commit_message:
Clearing the queue of vfs before starting next iteration in os-net-config

As moving to switchdev will remove the vfs and create bothe
vf-representros and uplink representor and the vf-queue will be
filled with these events, So we need to clear it before the next
iteration of next sriov_pf in order to parse events correctly for
vfs creation

Change-Id: I046b3c80fc2f017e8c6020954f3bc2c832772f1c
Closes-Bug: #1833073

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-03 18:41:57.000000000', 'message': 'Merge "Endpoint type for glanceclient"
(cherry picked from commit 4b7c4046cafcaf54268c00a10c767c9a2aa7280c)

Change-Id: Ibfa5cd8a48502c3dec357437fef0094ab8960a77
'}, {'created': '2019-07-03 20:18:04.000000000', 'message': "Endpoint type for glanceclient

At this moment nevertheless of 'endpoint_type' parameter from
'glance_client' section Zun always tries to interact with Glance
public API endpoint. If public API endpoint unaccessible from
compute nodes zun-compute service is unable to run new container
from image stored in the glance repository.

This patch intended to make Zun use 'endpoint_type' parameter
from 'glance_client' section of zun.conf file and pass the same
type of endpoint to the glanceclient.

Change-Id: Ibfa5cd8a48502c3dec357437fef0094ab8960a77
(cherry picked from commit bcd102c97e7aa6cff77273aa487c7dd70704d8d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Endpoint type for glanceclient

At this moment nevertheless of 'endpoint_type' parameter from
'glance_client' section Zun always tries to interact with Glance
public API endpoint. If public API endpoint unaccessible from
compute nodes zun-compute service is unable to run new container
from image stored in the glance repository.

This patch intended to make Zun use 'endpoint_type' parameter
from 'glance_client' section of zun.conf file and pass the same
type of endpoint to the glanceclient.

Change-Id: Ibfa5cd8a48502c3dec357437fef0094ab8960a77
(cherry picked from commit bcd102c97e7aa6cff77273aa487c7dd70704d8d0)

commit_message:
Add listener_id to pool_create

pool_create() is missing an argument called listener_id
When a user wants to associate the pool with a listener,
the user can pass the listener_id as one of the argument

Change-Id: Idd91e3bc3abfcb5cd150db9826e9b37aceec5525
Signed-off-by: Lucas H. Xu <hanxu@redhat.com>

commit_message:
List system dependencies for running common tests

Add an bindep.txt file containing a cross-platform list of
dependencies needed for running included tox-based tests. Also include a
tox environment for convenience calling the bindep[*] utility to list
any missing system requirements.

For bindep.txt see also
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements

[*] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

Change-Id: I7fff1f20d50eacc4eb2f0b0f6f24ba521f5df5f7
(cherry picked from commit 9a13755cbe80f8eff88b8728b7250d8418cd768e)

commit_message:
List system dependencies for running common tests

Add an bindep.txt file containing a cross-platform list of
dependencies needed for running included tox-based tests. Also include a
tox environment for convenience calling the bindep[*] utility to list
any missing system requirements.

For bindep.txt see also
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements

[*] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

Change-Id: I7fff1f20d50eacc4eb2f0b0f6f24ba521f5df5f7

As Migration to bionic is completed or nodejs10 job running.
So we not required nodejs4 job anymore.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666493/

Change-Id: I5d27dc7faeeba2702f30ac09c184edd9e7dae697

commit_message:
tempest: re-enable shelve tests for train

The dependent nova fix resolves the issue with rbd and
shelve/unshelve testing in tempest. Re-enabling the test
needs to be branch-specific since devstack-plugin-ceph
is branch-less but the fixes in nova will be branch
specific so we don't want to enable this on any nova
branch that does not have the fix since it would break
the job on those branches.

Related-Bug: #1653953

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/457886/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ifbfc15033020c430a93574f2726b2279c9be130d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-04 03:44:21.000000000', 'message': 'Manage oslo_middleware/max_request_body_size

So that we can increase it from the default 114688

Useful in case for example the OS-Federation mapping is too large.

If this limit is breached cinder will return a 413 Entity Too Large
and not log anything to cinder.log.

Change-Id: I4364ef41400ea6c66c843318119f24ef7c47434b
Closes-Bug: #1835161
'}]
commit_message:
Manage oslo_middleware/max_request_body_size

So that we can increase it from the default 114688

Useful in case for example the OS-Federation mapping is too large.

If this limit is breached cinder will return a 413 Entity Too Large
and not log anything to cinder.log.

Change-Id: I4364ef41400ea6c66c843318119f24ef7c47434b
Closes-Bug: #1835161

commit_message:
ceilometer_agent_notification: disable-panko.yaml

ceilometer-agent-notification.yaml updated the
kolla_config section in template file to include
nothing related to panko when disable-panko env file is passed.

Closes-Bug: #1824840

Change-Id: Ia71e80c84449209653609c911fef4cb3cdce5b5c
(cherry picked from commit 8fac4c4334ad2b2ef67040d053a58a9ba8857425)
(cherry picked from commit 9a1491a42fd6679b9222eb22af5844ce3edf5067)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-05-09 15:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Brilliant as usual, thanks Zane.

I was just wondering if we should grandfather in the existing ones and consider them as the "2019" set, even if the wording is imperfect. I would really prefer to sync the list rotation on the calendar year (ti simplify communications, but also to be able to feature it in the OSF annual report), so asking people to submit now to be approved in June and resubmitted 5 months later for inclusion in the 2020 list might be a bit too much to ask...'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-05-09 16:25:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ah, so as written I have it syncing on the release cycle, so when V opens in ~March we'll remove items added during Train. (This also means we don't end up clearing out the whole list at once.) If it's important to align with a calendar year we can change it - it's a bit more for the TC chair to remember I guess was the reason I didn't start with that."}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-05-10 14:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(6 comments)

Edits to the main page.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-05-22 09:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Re: alignment with calendar year, I feel like it makes it more consumable by the target audience. Also reinforces that the need is not cycle-based (compared to other efforts like goal championing)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-05-22 13:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from investment to documentation-change'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-05-28 23:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-05-29 00:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from investment to documentation-change'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-05-29 00:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from documentation-change to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-05-29 12:54:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

+1 on this. remember we have shared this list link in many places so if we delay to fill the content in the new structure, there might be the wrong message to them that there is no such list now. I completely on side of either keeping the old list until we fill the new list with items.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-06-13 17:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-06-13 17:50:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-06-13 18:36:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1

To clarify what I meant by 'rewrite': it's not my intention that we should ever modify the contents of the '2018' entries again, just that we should add entries to 2019 that are equivalent to the old entries but written in the new format.

The etherpad where that is happening is here: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/2019-upstream-investment-opportunities-refactor"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-06-14 07:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-06 20:02:52.000000000', 'message': "Convert 'Help Most Needed' to 'Upstream Investment Opportunities'

The previous 'Help Most Needed' list was presenting information in a way
that focused on the desires of the community rather than the value that
sponsoring organisations can generate - for both themselves and the
commons. Replace the list with a new list of 'Upstream Investment
Opportunities', and a process to keep them current by removing them
after they have been on the list for between 6 months and a year, so
that the submitter is forced to reaffirm their interest and the TC is
forced to re-evaluate the relevancy.

Since the current 'Help Most Needed' entries are generally not written
in a style emphasising the value to a business of investing, the initial
list is empty and will be filled as the TC evaluates business cases
according to its new criteria and understanding of the needs of
potential contributing organisations.

Change-Id: I65fef701dc2e3d50aa84e7ee79b068c78346c846

commit_message:
Convert 'Help Most Needed' to 'Upstream Investment Opportunities'

The previous 'Help Most Needed' list was presenting information in a way
that focused on the desires of the community rather than the value that
sponsoring organisations can generate - for both themselves and the
commons. Replace the list with a new list of 'Upstream Investment
Opportunities', and a process to keep them current by removing them
after they have been on the list for between 6 months and a year, so
that the submitter is forced to reaffirm their interest and the TC is
forced to re-evaluate the relevancy.

Since the current 'Help Most Needed' entries are generally not written
in a style emphasising the value to a business of investing, the initial
list is empty and will be filled as the TC evaluates business cases
according to its new criteria and understanding of the needs of
potential contributing organisations.

To preserve the existing information, the contents of the current 'Help
Most Needed' list appear as the 2018 upstream investment opportunites.
Links to the old list will temporarily redirect here until such time as
the new entries are in place, at which point we can redirect to the main
page with the latest index.

Change-Id: I65fef701dc2e3d50aa84e7ee79b068c78346c846

commit_message:
Remove the redunant table from windows' editor

In windows env, cannot deal with '\t\t\t', maybe this is mistake
result in 'git pull' faild on windows env. In linux env show that(from
table):
[root@localhost manila]# vim releasenotes/notes/bug-1818081
bug-1818081-fix-inferred-script-name-in-case-of-proxy-urls-e33466af856708b4.yaml^I^I^I

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Idcfef4d6661e51ba36caa0885e36df3784e483ab
Story: #2005924
Task: #34234

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 15:12:38.000000000', 'message': 'Purge comp_node and res_prvdr records during deletion of cells/hosts

This patch adds a ``force`` option to nova-manage cell_v2 delete_host
using which the nova.compute_node records and nova_api.resource_provider
records will be purged when the host is deleted along with its mapping.

This patch also modifies the ``force`` option in nova-manage cell_v2
delete_cell to purge the nova.compute_node records instead of just
unmapping them and also removes the nova_api.resource_provider
records before deleting the host and cell mappings.

Change-Id: Ic36f8ecacf581aa1f975347b39ffd04c2dd82213
Closes-Bug: #1749734
'}, {'created': '2018-07-31 15:43:50.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup comp_node, res_prov, services, aggregate_hosts during cell deletion

This patch adds a ``recursively_force`` option to nova-manage cell_v2 delete_cell
using which in addition to just removing host and instance mappings, it will also
remove nodes, hosts from aggregates, resource_providers (with cascade) and all
cell services before deleting the cell.

commit_message:
Cleanup comp_node, res_prov, services, aggregate_hosts during cell deletion

This patch adds a ``recursively_force`` option to nova-manage cell_v2
delete_cell using which in addition to just removing host and instance
mappings, it will also remove nodes, hosts from aggregates,
resource_providers (with cascade) and all cell services before deleting
the cell.

Change-Id: Ic36f8ecacf581aa1f975347b39ffd04c2dd82213
Closes-Bug: #1749734

commit_message:
[WIP] [EXP] Add ceph-grafana-dashboards to overcloud image

With ceph nautilus and the new dashboard we need
this package installed in the overcloud image because
it's a requirement to start the grafana server container.
This change adds the missing package.

Change-Id: I56d103f3b3696393b0a630446e8b55fd18a0164e

commit_message:
[DNM] Test change to check for port/instance project mismatch

This is a test change that adds a debug line to help me when I am
debugging a mismatch between the project_id on a port and the project_id
of an instance that is trying to use that port.  I don't expect this to
be reviewed or merged.

Change-Id: I18f67c4718a7053129ade67df765049aa272a1e0

commit_message:
Update test cases for os-pki revoke API

Since os-pki API is deprecated and isn't supported
Thus it will return 403 forbidden. The tests was
incorrectly inheriting from object and not a unit
test class and so wasn't being run.

Change-Id: I6050a57cb77ebde42b77a39623e043544e3d6381

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-01 11:01:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add custom ethertype processing

The OVS Firewall blocks traffic that does not have either the IPv4 or
IPv6 ethertypes at present.  This is a behavior change compared to the
iptables_hybrid firewall, which only operates on IP packets and thus
does not address other ethertypes.

This is a lightweight change that sets a configuration option in the
neutron openvswitch agent configuration file for permitted ethertypes
and then ensures that the requested ethertypes are permitted on
initialization.  This addresses the security and usability concerns on
both master and stable branches while a full-fledged extension to the
security groups API is considered.

Change-Id: Ide78b0b90cf6d6069ce3787fc60766be52062da0
Related-Bug: #1832758
(cherry picked from commit 9ea6a616658268b833ccb787c181962898863058)

The OVS Firewall blocks traffic that does not have either the IPv4 or

This is a lightweight change that sets a configuration option in the

and then ensures that the requested ethertypes are permitted on

Change-Id: Ide78b0b90cf6d6069ce3787fc60766be52062da0

commit_message:
Add custom ethertype processing

The OVS Firewall blocks traffic that does not have either the IPv4 or
IPv6 ethertypes at present.  This is a behavior change compared to the
iptables_hybrid firewall, which only operates on IP packets and thus
does not address other ethertypes.

This is a lightweight change that sets a configuration option in the
neutron openvswitch agent configuration file for permitted ethertypes
and then ensures that the requested ethertypes are permitted on
initialization.  This addresses the security and usability concerns on
both master and stable branches while a full-fledged extension to the
security groups API is considered.

Change-Id: Ide78b0b90cf6d6069ce3787fc60766be52062da0
Related-Bug: #1832758
(cherry picked from commit 9ea6a616658268b833ccb787c181962898863058)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-03 13:21:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add bindep.txt and ignore sha1 warning

This is a combination of 2 commits to pass the check and gate jobs.

1. Add bindep.txt for Octavia

Some base packages are no longer automatically included in zuul
job runs. This is good as we need to call out our platform package
requirements.
This patch adds a bindep.txt to Octavia to capture those
package requirements.

(cherry picked from commit d9c459a8686817bdaf4967ffb45b2c180a5e4265)

2. "Resolve" bandit issue with sha1 hashes

We only use them as a consistent hash, not for anything security
related. Even if someone could manage a hash collision or something,
the worst that could happen is their own LB stops working...
So, just tell bandit to ignore them.
Added a docstring to one function to attempt to be extra clear.

Conflicts:
      octavia/common/tls_utils/cert_parser.py
Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to not having patch
I039ed0b40df8b72a1238f8896548fe77086c530c on stable pike.

(cherry picked from commit 91fae05a7d53362f5484154fc35c921f3482bc2f)
(cherry picked from commit 12bf4409faabfd4437d4f09a06cd216b24064ee7)

Change-Id: I48e82f39e3980d6d50e3b710326b8e437eddb08b
(cherry picked from commit af80b8f719bda324a75507b266dcd2f0cf2aeedc)
'}]
commit_message:
Add bindep.txt and ignore sha1 warning

This is a combination of 2 commits to pass the check and gate jobs.

1. Add bindep.txt for Octavia

Some base packages are no longer automatically included in zuul
job runs. This is good as we need to call out our platform package
requirements.
This patch adds a bindep.txt to Octavia to capture those
package requirements.

(cherry picked from commit d9c459a8686817bdaf4967ffb45b2c180a5e4265)

2. "Resolve" bandit issue with sha1 hashes

We only use them as a consistent hash, not for anything security
related. Even if someone could manage a hash collision or something,
the worst that could happen is their own LB stops working...
So, just tell bandit to ignore them.
Added a docstring to one function to attempt to be extra clear.

Conflicts:
      octavia/common/tls_utils/cert_parser.py
Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to not having patch
I039ed0b40df8b72a1238f8896548fe77086c530c on stable pike.

(cherry picked from commit 91fae05a7d53362f5484154fc35c921f3482bc2f)
(cherry picked from commit 12bf4409faabfd4437d4f09a06cd216b24064ee7)

Change-Id: I48e82f39e3980d6d50e3b710326b8e437eddb08b
(cherry picked from commit af80b8f719bda324a75507b266dcd2f0cf2aeedc)

commit_message:
Fix cryptsetup --pbkdf-memory failures

A recent patch[1] added --pbkdf-memory to the cryptsetup command line
to limit the memory cryptsetup is using. However, some distros use
an older version of cryptsetup that does not need this setting.
This patch adds logic to detect this and run the commands without
--pbkdf-memory.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/663784

Change-Id: I9e0debcbfe6ceeff0012c827d70d80d938b5a2fb
Story: 2006066
Task: 34782

commit_message:
Per-Role krb-service-principal for CompactServices

Filter krb-service-principals for the CompactServices
based on the networks associated with the role.

Filtering for the IndividualServices was added in previous
fix https://review.openstack.org/646005, which did'nt
fully fix the bug.

commit_message:
Remove irrelevant files

This change rmeoves files that serve no purpose. Most of these things
were brought over on the initial role import and were kept for
consistency. Now that we can test the roles and are confident in the
setup it is time to clean things up by removing files and options
that are empty or pointless.

Change-Id: I832c003a36d82cf37d128e5934aeb5448112e6f8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

Increase the randomness in the name generation, to avoid problems
like in [1].

The "tearDown" definition is removed from "TestZone" class. This

commit_message:
Increase randomness in ZONE creation

Increase the randomness in the name generation, to avoid problems
like in [1].

The "tearDown" definition is removed from "TestZone" class. This
method is not needed, as long as "addCleanup" will always ensure
the DNS zone is deleted.

[1]http://logs.openstack.org/04/668304/7/check/openstacksdk-functional-devstack-networking/1416912/testr_results.html.gz

Change-Id: Ibc130d57596b85310a7d53d40610a470777f9b84

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-05 16:53:11.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder: Require cinder volume to be running before attempting bootstrap

This PS udpates the deps on the cinder boostrap job to ensure that the
cinder volume service has started prior to attempting bootstrap.

This crtainly could be enhanced further, but is the 1st step in preventing
the liklyhood of a race.

Change-Id: Id0f958077b296750242450179b41c0a1b703b4a5
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder: Require cinder volume to be running before attempting bootstrap

This PS udpates the deps on the cinder boostrap job to ensure that the
cinder volume service has started prior to attempting bootstrap.

This crtainly could be enhanced further, but is the 1st step in preventing
the liklyhood of a race.

Change-Id: Id0f958077b296750242450179b41c0a1b703b4a5
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

[{'created': '2018-10-15 14:16:00.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I65ce11fff1f652fe0e0aa6595c1b3c6d96191233
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440
"}]
commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I65ce11fff1f652fe0e0aa6595c1b3c6d96191233
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440

security contexts for the components of the neutron chart. This

instead of a single 'neutron' key that maps to every pod

This also removes the .pod.user.neutron.uid key in favor of using

Change-Id: I1c87a5b4b74e2a2d17b8913dd34f40dc1c38fbe0

commit_message:
Neutron: Fix security context values keys

This updates the values used for generating the pod and container
security contexts for the components of the neutron chart. This
moves to using a unique application key for each neutron service
instead of a single 'neutron' key that maps to every pod

This also removes the .pod.user.neutron.uid key in favor of using
the user key in the security_context values tree

Change-Id: I1c87a5b4b74e2a2d17b8913dd34f40dc1c38fbe0
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-05 06:32:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the cross_az_attach value in AZ-unshelved spec

If CONF.cinder.cross_az_attach is True, then nova allow
to use the different availability zone among server and
attached volume. If False, then both availability zone
has to be same[1].

Spec mentioned the cross_az_attach value wrongly.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/configuration/config.html#cinder.cross_az_attach

Change-Id: I53db20b8fd07ae931891b984276236b550d45ed4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the cross_az_attach value in AZ-unshelved spec

If CONF.cinder.cross_az_attach is True, then nova allow
to use the different availability zone among server and
attached volume. If False, then both availability zone
has to be same[1].

Spec mentioned the cross_az_attach value wrongly.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/configuration/config.html#cinder.cross_az_attach

Change-Id: I53db20b8fd07ae931891b984276236b550d45ed4

commit_message:
Increase admin project quotas

As DevStack's Octavia is using admin project for creation of all the
Amphora resources, this commit increases quota for SG's and instances to
100, to make sure that in tests we're able to create enough LB's.

Change-Id: I9aab95f14b936f686dcfb9c0dc5521dbc2ffcada
Closes-Bug: 1834497

[{'created': '2019-06-18 12:41:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove subPaths when mounting Kuryr pods volumes

From time to time in the gate we suffer from Kubernetes/Docker bug [1].
As it seems to still be open, we can work it around by removing usage of
subPath property of volumeMounts attached to Kuryr pods and this commit
does so. Besides that it removes possibility of providing different
kuryr.conf for kuryr-controller and kuryr-daemon as this shouldn't be
required as we don't support running without kuryr-daemon anymore.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/68211

commit_message:
Remove subPaths when mounting Kuryr pods volumes

From time to time in the gate we suffer from Kubernetes/Docker bug [1].
As it seems to still be open, we can work it around by removing usage of
subPath property of volumeMounts attached to Kuryr pods and this commit
does so. Besides that it removes possibility of providing different
kuryr.conf for kuryr-controller and kuryr-daemon as this shouldn't be
required as we don't support running without kuryr-daemon anymore.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/68211

Closes-Bug: 1833228
Change-Id: I2465bc45324482cc4ab32a1367ab08f34ce28b1c

Ceph-Provisioner: wait for helm tests related pods

commit_message:
Refactor qos_plugin._extend_port_resource_request

In order to speed up the port collection, some DB calls
have been deleted in the extended function
"QoSPlugin._extend_port_resource_request".

With the parent commit, the port DB/OVO object now has the
network QoS policy ID, making the network retrieval unneeded.

In this refactor the QoS policy is collected from the DB only
if a valid QoS policy ID exists, bound to the port or to the
network. This reduces the number of QoS objects collection to
one or zero.

Change-Id: Iadf704c00378da99c502dca3e3b79796c368cac7
Closes-Bug: #1834484

commit_message:
Allow deeper levels of nesting for pdf builds

Change the defaults for the max of a 5 of \begin...\end stanzas,
up to a 10.

Change-Id: I52ef17bd87cbcde7f9dc34e8b1bb874581d0917d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-04 13:11:53.000000000', 'message': "Disable Docker in default Standalone environments

Podman is the default in standalone generated environments
(e.g. environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml), however since we
haven't made it the default in overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml
until we get CentOS8, docker was still being deployed because the
roles/Standalone.yaml used to contain the Docker service.

This patch aims to make sure we disable Docker.

Closes-Bug: #1835411
Change-Id: Ib34ba24c84f34a1533a90189d5154825c6dfa868
"}, {'created': '2019-07-04 18:47:05.000000000', 'message': "Disable Docker in default Standalone environments

Podman is the default in standalone generated environments
(e.g. environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml), however since we
haven't made it the default in overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml
until we get CentOS8, docker was still being deployed because the
roles/Standalone.yaml used to contain the Docker service.

Note: for scenario004 & 012, we need to enable Docker as Pacemaker is

commit_message:
Disable Docker in default Standalone environments

Podman is the default in standalone generated environments
(e.g. environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml), however since we
haven't made it the default in overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml
until we get CentOS8, docker was still being deployed because the
roles/Standalone.yaml used to contain the Docker service.

This patch aims to make sure we disable Docker.
Note: for scenario004 & 012, we need to enable Docker as Pacemaker is
enabled and the job runs on CentOS7.

Closes-Bug: #1835411
Change-Id: Ib34ba24c84f34a1533a90189d5154825c6dfa868

commit_message:
Make nova ephemeral storage backend configurable per-role

When multiple Compute roles are used, admins may want to use different storage
backends on each role.

This change turns NovaEnableRbdBackend into a role specific param.
Any other config that is implicitly enabled by the global NovaEnableRbdBackend
now requires a dedicated param.

Co-Authored-By: ratailor@redhat.com
Change-Id: I9f40a2a3561fcb1d1fec9d9c3c1f9cabaf02650c
Implements: blueprint nova-backend-per-role

commit_message:
Rabbit: Ensure node has joined cluster on initial startup

This PS extends the rabbit startup locgic to ensure nodes have
actually joined the cluster on startup.

Change-Id: Ib876d9abd89209d0a7972983bdf4daacf5f8f582
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Add sphinx_python to the reno jobs

We need to set the version of python we use for the reno jobs so
that its able to run the pre-setup tasks. This issue is being
worked on upstream [0][1], however, until those changes are
merged we'll need to carry these vars.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668954
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669008

Change-Id: Idd4edf2173dd62112e27ec2501b3f8ccb4c4427e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix invalid assertIsNone states

This is to fix the invalid assertIsNone states, like:
    self.assertIsNone(None, cn2_db['%s_allocation_ratio' % x])
    self.assertIsNone(None, req.requests[0].requester_id)

Change-Id: I50ef705dbd737b8a7f4c64b27c57996137a933de

[{'created': '2019-06-18 05:46:02.000000000', 'message': 'Stop logging lshw output, collect it with other logs instead

The lshw output is huge even on virtual machines, and it pollutes
the debug logging. This change silences it. Instead, the lshw output
is collected as part of the ramdisk logs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665635/
Change-Id: I6a3015b2d8d09f6f48b5cbd39dc84bd75b72f909
(cherry picked from commit 94048fe97e93af3ad6902c3c1aa4ec5d92b41747)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop logging lshw output, collect it with other logs instead

The lshw output is huge even on virtual machines, and it pollutes
the debug logging. This change silences it. Instead, the lshw output
is collected as part of the ramdisk logs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665635/
Change-Id: I6a3015b2d8d09f6f48b5cbd39dc84bd75b72f909
(cherry picked from commit 94048fe97e93af3ad6902c3c1aa4ec5d92b41747)

commit_message:
Use openstacksdk for accessing Swift

This change replaces the swiftclient dependency with openstacksdk.
The ultimate goal is to use only openstacksdk for all cross-service
interactions.

The configuration option max_retires has been broken for several
releases since commit 7e8cdc0d0f2bff863e1dc8fac12051187a9862b7,
this change deprecates it.

Change-Id: I635519f88e90f4267ff7a9cb063a697ff39e4710

[{'created': '2019-06-07 10:37:33.000000000', 'message': 'tox: Use basepython of python3.5

On hosts that provide Python 3.7, like Fedora 20, anything that doesn't
set an explicit Python 3 version is currently failing due to
zKVMCloudConnector explicitly stating it doesn't support Python < 3.6
(who knows why):

  $ tox -e docs
  ...
  Collecting zVMCloudConnector===1.2.2 (from -c https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/rocky (line 145))
    Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/a1/da/f5a4432ebcbb630ce9a25d0ec81599fff7e473b5df7f73595783e39dba2d/zVMCloudConnector-1.2.2.tar.gz (183kB)
      ERROR: Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
      ERROR: Traceback (most recent call last):
        File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
        File "/tmp/pip-install-dci83kk9/zVMCloudConnector/setup.py", line 18, in <module>
          from zvmsdk import version as sdkversion
        File "/tmp/pip-install-dci83kk9/zVMCloudConnector/zvmsdk/version.py", line 29, in <module>
          raise RuntimeError('On Python 3, zvm sdk supports to Python 3.6')
      RuntimeError: On Python 3, zvm sdk supports to Python 3.6

Explicitly request a basepython of python3.5, which is what we supported
on stable/rocky to avoid. This stable only since the problem doesn't
happen on master, where a newer zVMCloudConnector package is available.

Change-Id: I99c8d115be695215a798a0fb2990279237ddf4d3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Stable-Only
'}]
commit_message:
tox: Use basepython of python3.5

On hosts that provide Python 3.7, like Fedora 20, anything that doesn't
set an explicit Python 3 version is currently failing due to
zKVMCloudConnector explicitly stating it doesn't support Python < 3.6
(who knows why):

  $ tox -e docs
  ...
  Collecting zVMCloudConnector===1.2.2 (from -c https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/rocky (line 145))
    Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/a1/da/f5a4432ebcbb630ce9a25d0ec81599fff7e473b5df7f73595783e39dba2d/zVMCloudConnector-1.2.2.tar.gz (183kB)
      ERROR: Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
      ERROR: Traceback (most recent call last):
        File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
        File "/tmp/pip-install-dci83kk9/zVMCloudConnector/setup.py", line 18, in <module>
          from zvmsdk import version as sdkversion
        File "/tmp/pip-install-dci83kk9/zVMCloudConnector/zvmsdk/version.py", line 29, in <module>
          raise RuntimeError('On Python 3, zvm sdk supports to Python 3.6')
      RuntimeError: On Python 3, zvm sdk supports to Python 3.6

Explicitly request a basepython of python3.5, which is what we supported
on stable/rocky to avoid. This stable only since the problem doesn't
happen on master, where a newer zVMCloudConnector package is available.

Change-Id: I99c8d115be695215a798a0fb2990279237ddf4d3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Stable-Only

commit_message:
Stop writing allnodes_vars in inventory

In commit 4c34147cc1d268116421252d46a7204227f10fb3 AllNodesConfig
stack output was removed, so there is no point of writing
all_nodes_vars any more.

Change-Id: If2656e6b5ef6a6ad8a18c85aadbfc982a4e646a5

Added field "qos_network_policy_id" to Port OVO. This parameter
will be used to retrieve the QoS policy bound to the port network.
This reduces the number of calls to the database by creating a join
between the QosNetworkPolicyBinding table and the Port table, based
on the network ID.

This backref association is not persistent (marked as "viewonly").
This relationship is using for loading the QoS policy ID of the
port network in the Port OVO.

Related-Bug: #1834484

Change-Id: I219a925d5e269b8c73a0481daa879d72c399fd8f

commit_message:
Add qos_network_policy_id to Port OVO

Added field "qos_network_policy_id" to Port OVO. This parameter
will be used to retrieve the QoS policy bound to the port network.
This reduces the number of calls to the database by creating a join
between the QosNetworkPolicyBinding table and the Port table, based
on the network ID.

This backref association is not persistent (marked as "viewonly").
This relationship is using for loading the QoS policy ID of the
port network in the Port OVO.

Related-Bug: #1834484

Change-Id: I219a925d5e269b8c73a0481daa879d72c399fd8f

commit_message:
Octaiva Load Balancing CI

This patch adds the octavia CI and removes the legacy neutron
load balancing ci, which is not working properly previously

Change-Id: I78ebf57edcdd9d686ab74ee620c71bd5dfe6e551
Signed-off-by: Lucas H. Xu <hanxu@redhat.com>

commit_message:
New rally scenario: bind port

As discussed on the Denver 2019 PTG we should improve the performance
testing of neutron port binding. This change introduces a scenario that
does just that. The intent is to make this scenario quite realistic so
it exercises all relevant code paths in neutron.

Change-Id: I76356ca3fa2ea6ec6e1f2e34a4fce695b1509eb2
Partial-Bug: #1833674

subject: Specifying az when restore shelved server
messages:
[{'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-12-12 12:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-12-12 12:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-03 23:54:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Soft -1 for getting more details, but I don't see a major reason not to allow this since unshelve is really just like server create except it's an existing server with existing ports/volumes.

It might be worth socializing this in the mailing list to see if other users are looking for this functionality, or if operators have had requests for this from their users."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-01-04 08:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

Thanks Matt, add the necessary details and update this.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-01-04 09:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-01-04 09:47:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-04 22:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-04 22:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-04 22:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

To be clear, my -1 is mostly about cleaning up the spec, not about the proposal itself.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-01-07 03:06:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-01-07 03:30:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(10 comments)

> To be clear, my -1 is mostly about cleaning up the spec, not about
 > the proposal itself.

Thanks Matt.
I considered and discussed it in our group and thought there are two options here (for reference only):
1. Do not clean up RequestSpec.availability_zone, determine whether AZ has changed during unshelve, and then select the unshelve processing method - using the user specifying AZ to restore, or using [DEFAULT]/default_schedule_zone (when not specifying AZ);
2. Set RequestSpec.availability_zone is None, but this will clear the RequestSpec.availability_zone set when first created, and can't track changes in server availability_zone (not what I think)."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-04-02 02:13:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-04-02 05:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2019-04-18 08:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(6 comments)

I would support this if it weren't for the ZONE:HOST:NODE thing where the HOST:NODE forcefully bypass the scheduler filters and put the server on the given host/node, which we're trying to do away with:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/add-host-and-hypervisor-hostname-flag-to-create-server.html

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/remove-force-flag-from-live-migrate-and-evacuate.html

And we also pushed back on adding the ability to force a specified target host during cold migrate."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-23 20:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-23 20:06:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(7 comments)

Thanks Matt and Alex, I will update these suggestions, and adopt your suggestion, using 'host_name' and 'hypervisor_hostname' instead of force host and/or node, I also prefer this way."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-04-30 00:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-04-30 01:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(13 comments)

This is looking mostly OK but some things need to be corrected within and I think it's a bit confusing over whether or not the forced host/node behavior is going to be supported with this or not. I think from earlier discussions we said we would not support the zone:host:node format to force the host/node and bypass the scheduler, but the spec doesn't read that way to me. If we want to clarify and get wider input we should ask in the mailing list."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-06-04 21:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Specifying az when restore shelved server

This spec proposes support admin/user to specify
``availability_zone`` to unshelve a shelved server.

APIImpact

Blueprint: support-specifying-az-when-restore-shelved-server
Change-Id: I0d4855c100a43548019cd0330ec325ba8b8c686d

commit_message:
Make tripleo-ci-fedora-28-standalone non voting

Unblocks multiple jobs which fail on fedora-28 for reasons unreletead to
them.

Support for Fedora 28 is mostly experimental and relies on CRs that
are not even planned to be merged, thus its status should be informative
than authoritative.

Change-Id: I5b0ea6e54cbbe77bb290fcaad1b2faf60243ed37

Thanks for digging that out. Turns out in the kolla_docker module we just ignore 'never' because it's the default, so it doesn't matter that it's incorrect.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-06-25 18:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I wonder whether we really do not want this behavior in master as it seems reasonable in general.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-25 18:08:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I wonder whether we really do not want this behavior in master as

All other branches work just via 'docker restart'. We need all this extra stuff in stein because some older rocky images might not handle 'docker stop' properly due to bug 1834191."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-06-25 18:15:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

You mean https://launchpad.net/bugs/1820325 ok, thanks, that made it clear to me now. Sorry for not reading carefully. :P"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-25 19:14:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yeah that's the one :)"}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-06-25 20:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30381, 'date': '2019-06-25 21:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-26 08:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1
